div.p: An optional, wrapping element that may be utilized to encode formatting features that are not part of the EAS data model. When using the EAS-provided NVDL Schema validaiton procedure, this element will require that all elements encoded within are from the XHTML namespace.
Any element that is in a namespace other than the current namespace.

accessConditions (0..1), accruals (0..1), abstract (0..1), appraisal (0..1), arrangement (0..1), bioghist (0..1), custodHist (0..1), descriptionOfComponents (0..1), filePlan (0..1), findAidDesc (0..n), formAvailable (0..1), otherDescriptiveInfo (0..1), otherFindAid (0..1), physicalOrTechnicalRequirements (0..1), preferCite (0..1), processInfo (0..1), publicationNote (0..1), relatedMaterial (0..1), scopeContent (0..1), separatedMaterial (0..1), sourceOfAcquisition (0..1), subjectHeadings (0..1), useConditions (0..1)
formattingExtension provides the option to embed external namespaces directly within the source file, when complex formatting is required. It should preferably be used for embedding XHTML data.
When using this element, it is recommended that the EAS file is associated with the EAS NVDL for validation purposes.
Optional. Only repeatable within the context of findAidDesc.

When used outside of findAidDesc to encode a narrative description, the encoder must choose between using a formattingExtention element (to wrap XHTML content), or to use one or more p elements that are defined within the current EAS schema.
